message_1: Consider an auction where 4 bidders are vying for a painting. Each bidder has their own estimated value for the painting as follows: Bidder 1 - $3000, Bidder 2 - $4500, Bidder 3 - $6000, and Bidder 4 - $7500. The auctioneer decides to use a second-price sealed-bid auction (Vickrey auction). What will be the final selling price of the painting and which bidder will win the auction?
message_2:
In a second-price sealed-bid auction (Vickrey auction), the highest bidder wins the auction but pays the price submitted by the second-highest bidder.

In this case, the bids are as follows:
Bidder 1 - $3000
Bidder 2 - $4500
Bidder 3 - $6000
Bidder 4 - $7500

Bidder 4 has the highest bid at $7500, so they will win the auction. However, they will pay the price submitted by the second-highest bidder, which is Bidder 3 with a bid of $6000.

So, the final selling price of the painting will be $6000, and Bidder 4 will win the auction.
